climbs.name: The Wizard
climbs.fa: FA - Cabe and Phil Reynolds, April 2017

content.description: A difficult mix of hand, finger jams and dicey face moves lead up a diagonal right hand vertical traverse under a imperceptible overhang of 10+ feet.  Two old fixed pins can be clipped along with medium to large cams to protect from extreme ground fall risk.
content.location: Find obvious right leaning crack system on east side of the formation.  Start from ledge steps or scramble to top of small pillar. Rap from top to the east on fixed anchors or 4th class down climb saddle between The Represstional and Sabbath Slab.

climbs.name: Sabbra Cadabra
climbs.fa: FA- Phil and Cabe Reynolds, May 2016

content.description: A tricky balancy start through a small roof, crux, gives way to thin slab climbing with fun finger and hand jams in left facing diheadral.  Finish straight up face above giant ledge through second crux 5.10-.  See Leper Messiah route.
content.protection: Trad rack with small TCU's and nuts.
content.location: From the grassy low spot at base of formation head straight up center of face towards left hand diheadral.

climbs.name: Leper Messiah
climbs.fa: FA- Phil and Cabe Reynolds, May 2016

content.description: Classic traditional climbing with cracks, face, and jams on clean solid rock. Short crux section near top has several variations.  Great gear placements the whole way.
content.protection: Trad rack with hexes and cams to 3 inches.
content.location: Route starts at obvious arete on west edge of The Represstional and follows blocky steps at bottom until route becomes more vertical in about 30 feet.  Stay right on face making some then friction moves until giant ledge.  Go right on easy ramp 5.6 and scramble left to summit.   Variation from giant ledge is straight up 15 feet inon smooth face 5.10- with RP's or micro nuts for pro.

climbs.name: Judas Kiss
climbs.fa: FA - Phil and Cabe Reynolds,  Oct 2018

content.description: Steep face climbing with unique features leads to a large roof near the top and the short crux.  Turn roof with a stem or lay back and on to summit.
content.location: Start same as Naughty Thoughts and then contrive a odd balancy line  to the left edge of face under roof.

climbs.name: Jeebus Heard My Naughty Thought
climbs.fa: FA - Phil and Cabe Reynolds, April 2015

content.description: Best trad route in the area.  Glassy solid quartz is pockmarked with unusual pockets and other features.  Use three finger pocket near bottom to pass the crux then continue up sustained difficulty face staying right until the top
content.location: Route ascends up the middle of the impressive west face.  Start by stemming up simple chimney at bottom.

climbs.name: Houses of the Holy
climbs.fa: FA - Phil and Cabe Reynolds, April 2015

content.description: Friction face moves after a bouldery start move up the slab staying on the glassy face with few small cracks and sparse gear.  Exit using the ramp from the giant ledge 5.6
content.protection: Standard trad rack with small nuts.
content.location: Same start as Sabbra Cadabra, from the low point in the center of the formation, but quickly moves left and on to face.

climbs.name: Dolus Magus
climbs.fa: FA - Phil and Cabe Reynolds,  Oct 2018

content.description: Face climbing and cracks with unique features on solid rock.
content.location: Start same as Naughty Thoughts moving immediately right after chimney.

climbs.name: The Burning is Love
climbs.fa: FA- Phil and Andrea Reynolds, October 2017

content.protection: Trad rack with small TCU's and micro nuts.
